hook.text: That song stuck in your head? Scientists call it an involuntary musical image.

buildup.text: About 90 percent of people experience earworms at least once a week.

discovery.text: Earworms tend to be songs with simple, repetitive melodies and unexpected intervals.

twist.text: Trying to suppress an earworm makes it worse â€” like trying not to think of a pink elephant.

climax.text: Chewing gum disrupts the auditory loop and can stop an earworm.

punchline.text: Your brain is a jukebox that sometimes picks the song for you.

quiz.question: What can help stop an earworm?
options: Chewing gum to disrupt the auditory loop
